result.execSummary:
The defendant Ross D Borucki was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ross D Borucki is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ross D Borucki was found guilty of Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).
  • Ross D Borucki was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ross D Borucki in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has fulfilled the deferred prosecution agreement and court vacates previously findings.   Defendant pleads guilty to Count 2 and 6 of the Amended Information.  Count 4 is dismissed outright.  Counts 8, 10 and 12 are dismissed and read-in.  Court imposes the following sentence:

 The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

WITHHELD SENTENCE:  AS TO EACH COUNT

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS AS TO EACH COUNT 
If revoked, 3 days credit

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

Probation can be transferred to Milwaukee County

RESTITUTION:  $750 to Kevin Brandt and $200 to Rita Olson, jointly and severally;  $100 from bail to remain in trust.  State to turn over $200 previously posted in New Berlin to Ms. Olson. If they don't have the $200.00, then  $100 left in trust to go to Ms. Olson for restitution. Bail to be applied to the $750 restitution and the costs and surcharges. 

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 as to each count (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 as to each count (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DRGOD SURCHARGE:  $10.00 as to count  2

Defendant may petition for early termination after 12 months of probation (upon all fees and compliance being made with probation).
Sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ross D Borucki in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant remains compliant with the program. Graduation scheduled for 06/01/16 at this time.

Defendant Ross D Borucki in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Based on noncompliance: the Court orders an overnight sanction to be served as straight time.  Defendant to be released on Thursday, March 31, 2016.  Defendant remanded to custody of the Sheriff.

Defendant appeared in person.  Andrea Will appears on behalf of the state.  Based on noncompliance: the Court orders a 24 hour sanction to be served as straight time. Defendant to be released on September 3, 2015.  Defendant remanded to custody of the Sheriff.
Defendant Ross D Borucki in court.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Based on noncompliance: the Court orders an overnight sanction - STAYED.
